definition: in grave difficulties/the situation is grim

sentences.english: So I think we brace ourselves a tough year ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们将会面临形势严峻的一年。

sentences.english: Situation of non-ferrous metal mines is very severe.
sentences.chinese: 中国有色金属矿山资源形势严峻。

sentences.english: The situation in Gaza is grim.
College students' employment situation is very serious nowadays, even post-graduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生现在就业形势严峻，哪怕研究生找工作都难。

sentences.english: Front of the situation is grim, furious behind enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 前方形势严峻，后方敌特猖狂。

definition: more critical with every passing day
pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
(of diseases, accidents) to occur with a high incidence/(old) to score highly in the imperial exams
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to face sth/to be confronted with
a danger concealed within sth/hidden damage/misfortune not visible from the surface
